ODTBX Packaged Mice Toolkit

Mice is the Matlab version of the NAIF Spice Toolkit. This installation of the Mice toolkit was installed from the Orbit Determination Toolbox installer. This version is N0064, released June 11, 2010.

The full Mice documentation can be found at the link below.

Mice Documentation - NAIF Mice Toolkit Hypertext Documentation

The majority of the Mice APIs require downloaded kernels which are loaded with the cspice_furnsh function (see the "Most Used Mice APIs" link in the Mice Documentation). Thousands of kernels can be found for download at the NAIF ftp site. Mission-specific kernels are located in mission folders at the top level. The generic_kernels folder contains the general purpose kernels.

naif.jpl.nasa.gov ftp site - NAIF kernel ftp site containing thousands of kernels

Three kernels making up a standard kernel set have been packaged with the ODTBX installer, and are located in the mice/kernels folder. These may be loaded with the cspice_furnsh function (making sure to provide the full path name to the kernels in quotes).

de421.bsp - SPK Planetary ephemeris kernel

naif0009.tls - LSK Leapseconds kernel

pck00009.tpc - PCK Planetary constants kernel

Loading the mykernels.furnsh file with the cspice_furnsh function will load all three of these kernels, but it must be executed from the kernels folder. This file may be modified with full paths in order to run it from any folder.
